intro: Elynanthus cuspidatus, commonly known as the prickly hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Elynanthus cuspidatus is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and ditches.
